channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Faded white H lines, 21st September
item.description:
The lines were installed to provide safety for those using the public footpath Prestbury church/Southam, and to prevent blocking of access to residential homes in Shaw Green Lane. Since 18/07/2023 refreshment of the much faded lines has been repeatedly requested to Highways and Byways and the appropriate form submitted. To date no action has been taken. The lines have faded due to increased heavy traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Shaw Green Lane, Prestbury, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branch blocking footpath in wooded area, 21st September
item.description:
Blown down branch still attached to tree is causing a problem negotiating public footpath in small wooded area between fields.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentley Lane, Southam, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple deep potholes, 21st September
item.description:
There are 4 deep potholes at the top end of Oakland Avenue. Large stones from the subbase are coming out over the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Oakland Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste outside no 22 Russell street., 21st September
item.description:
The residents of that house (22 Russell street) constantly keep leaving waste items on the street, Can someone from council have a word with them please. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Russell Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath foliage needs more work., 21st September
item.description:
While someone has had a bit of a go it is not going to be long before it is overgrown again. Work needs to start at the brook and continue up the hill. There is still about 2 feet of path overgrown and it wouldn't hurt to sort out the overhead stuff too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Roman Hackle Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Can't walk on path due to hedge and excessive rubbish in area, 21st September
item.description:
Please could this hedge be sorted and all the excess rubbish in this area. It looks a right mess

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Gristmill Close, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foul/Sewage Water over flowing, 21st September
item.description:
Foul/Sewage water overflowing from manhole cover at the bottom of Billings Way at it's junction with Merestones Drive.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Billings Way, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in ground, possibly broken drain cover, 21st September
item.description:
Looks like this hole has the potential to get bigger, straight edge indicates drain cover or some such, could injure someone or something if it collapses. I noticed it yesterday on my dog walk

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car in Andover Street, 20th September
item.description:
A red Toyota Yaris AF59 XCB has been parked in Andover Street for over six weeks without moving. It has an L plate on it and the MOT has expired. Please could this be investigated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Andover Street, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedges obscuring view of traffic, 20th September
item.description:
The bushes along the footpath on Hatherley Road just beyond the Hatherley Gate and before Hatherley Court Gardens are overgrown. A resident who has tried to cut them back reported finding drugs paraphernalia in the undergrowth. Also, the bushes limit the view for drivers turning out of Hatherley Gate. This means that cars coming from the left, along Hatherley Road, only come into view when they are quite close to Hatherley Court Road making it dangerous when turning right onto Hatherley Road going towards Lansdown Road. I understand that these bushes are on land that is the responsibility of CBC.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Gate, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooded road / blocked drain Repeat problem, 20th September
item.description:
Recurring problem causes narrowing of road creating a dangerous junction

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glensanda Court, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement damgerous for wheelchairs, 20th September
item.description:
An elderly neighbour uses a 6 wheel wheelchair (2-2-2) to navigate the pavements of Benhall, but he fears getting round this corner. There is an exposed tree root and several raised slabs. His 4-wheeled wheelchair couldn't take this corner without tipping up. His current wheelchair can do it, but it's quite a hair-raising experience for a hemiplegic 80something year old.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Farmington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree started to blow over in the wind, 20th September
item.description:
With the high winds we've been having, this tree has gone over and is resting precariously against a hedge.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harry Yates Way, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large cone in road, 20th September
item.description:
A large unmarked cone has been placed on road by a house. You have to swerve to miss it, it is not lit at night and very dirty so it’s not easy to see in poor visibility. It looks like it has been placed on top of an access hatch. It is NOT safe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tatchley Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins left on grassed area for over a year, 18th September
item.description:
Bins left on grassed area opposite #1 saddlers road pirton fields Churchdown these Bins have not been moved for over a year they are full of soil rubbish and water

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saddler Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Flytip at the Location was set on Fire, 18th September
item.description:
The location is the Old Quarry Entrance off Cleeve Common Road. A fly tip was obviously made there and set on fire somertime on Thursday / Friday last week. Please can it be cleared up together with the small amount of mess behind the wall

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Noverton Lane, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 Deep potholes on a Blind Bend on Aggs Hill, 18th September
item.description:
The potholes are on a blind bend and vehicles going up and down Aggs Hill are moving to their opposite sides of the road to avoid them. Please can they be filled in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous loose dislodged bricks overhead., 17th September
item.description:
Vandals have accessed top of property to apply graffiti. In the process old bricks were dislodged & fell to the ground leaving a very unsafe hole with other loose bricks about to fall. Suggest immediate attention before further falling of the remaining loose bricks fall & hurt someone. It is the access alley to where disabled people park their cars to walk into town. Dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Salt Bin on Aggs Hill Hit by Vehicle into Road, 17th September
item.description:
The salt bin about half way up the steep part of Aggs Hill was hit by a vehicle last night - found early this morning in the middle of the road, blocking it. The sand / salt was strewn over the rod. The bin was moved off the road back to its positio. Please can it be re-positioned and filled up again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very noisy inspection hatch, 17th September
item.description:
Loud bang Everytime a vehicle goes over the hatch . There are several hatches in the area, so I was unable to indentify the specific one causing the problem, but if standing at the Monson Ave/Swindon Rd junction, it shouldn’t be long before you hear it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monson Avenue, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
